lead_paragraph: The Japanese automaker said its methods did not exaggerate results. Also Wednesday, the chief of Mitsubishi said he would resign after a fuel-test scandal there.

headline.print_headline: Suzuki Admits Test Flaw, but Denies It Cheated
headline.main: Suzuki Reports Improper Fuel Economy Tests, but Denies Cheating

snippet: The Japanese automaker said its methods did not exaggerate results. Also Wednesday, the chief of Mitsubishi said he would resign after a fuel-test scandal there.
abstract: Suzuki Motor admits it used improper methods to determine fuel economy of 16 vehicles it sells in Japan; says it had not intended to mislead customers, and that its testing had no exaggerated mileage ratings.
